alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 6:52AM EST until February 19 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 24.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM EST Saturday was 24.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 13.8 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.0 feet on 04/07/1936. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. The next statement will be issued 4 PM EST.
